ArticleTitle.sentence: T cells from renal cell carcinoma patients exhibit an abnormal pattern of kappa B-specific DNA-binding activity: a preliminary report.

event.clue: T cells from renal cell carcinoma patients exhibit an abnormal pattern of kappa B-specific DNA-binding activity: a preliminary report.
T cells from renal cell carcinoma patients exhibit an abnormal pattern of kappa B-specific DNA-binding activity: a preliminary report.

AbstractText.sentence: Recent data suggest that the poor induction of a T-cell response to human renal cell carcinoma (RCC) may be related to alterations in signal transduction pathways.

event.clue: Recent data suggest that the poor induction of a T-cell response to human renal cell carcinoma (RCC) may be related to alterations in signal transduction pathways.
Recent data suggest that the poor induction of a T-cell response to human renal cell carcinoma (RCC) may be related to alterations in signal transduction pathways.

AbstractText.sentence: We report that T cells from RCC patients have two alterations in kappa B motif-specific DNA-binding activity.

event.clue: We report that T cells from RCC patients have two alterations in kappa B motif-specific DNA-binding activity.
We report that T cells from RCC patients have two alterations in kappa B motif-specific DNA-binding activity.

AbstractText.sentence: The first alteration involves the constitutive expression of substantial kappa B-binding activity in nuclear extracts, which was observed in the electrophoretic mobility shift assay.

event.clue: The first alteration involves the constitutive expression of substantial kappa B-binding activity in nuclear extracts, which was observed in the electrophoretic mobility shift assay.
The first alteration involves the constitutive expression of substantial kappa B-binding activity in nuclear extracts, which was observed in the electrophoretic mobility shift assay.

AbstractText.sentence: The magnitude of kappa B activity in unstimulated patient T cells was similar to that observed in T cells from normal individuals that had been activated in vitro.

event.clue: The magnitude of kappa B activity in unstimulated patient T cells was similar to that observed in T cells from normal individuals that had been activated in vitro.
The magnitude of kappa B activity in unstimulated patient T cells was similar to that observed in T cells from normal individuals that had been activated in vitro.

AbstractText.sentence: On the basis of Western blotting experiments using antibodies to kappa B/Rel family proteins, the kappa B-binding activity constitutively expressed in T cells from RCC patients is composed mostly of the NF-kappa B1 (p50) subunit.

event.clue: On the basis of Western blotting experiments using antibodies to kappa B/Rel family proteins, the kappa B-binding activity constitutively expressed in T cells from RCC patients is composed mostly of the NF-kappa B1 (p50) subunit.
event.comment: NER T27, T28 MOD, TPS A5

AbstractText.sentence: The second abnormality in kappa B-binding activity in T cells from these patients is that RelA, a member of the Rel homology family which is part of the normal NF-kappa B complex, was not induced in the nucleus following activation.

event.clue: The second abnormality in kappa B-binding activity in T cells from these patients is that RelA, a member of the Rel homology family which is part of the normal NF-kappa B complex, was not induced in the nucleus following activation.

AbstractText.sentence: Western blotting analysis did not detect any RelA in nuclear extracts either before or after stimulation of T cells.

event.clue: Western blotting analysis did not detect any RelA in nuclear extracts either before or after stimulation of T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The altered kappa B-binding activity in T cells from RCC patients may impair their capacity to respond normally to various stimuli.

event.clue: The altered kappa B-binding activity in T cells from RCC patients may impair their capacity to respond normally to various stimuli.
